author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1683143811}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198390980360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1690716816}
review:
I had fun with this game; for an RPG maker game I would say it's pretty good.  There are 4 levels of difficulty to choose from, Ataraxia (Very Easy, most extra health), Utopia (Easy, extra health), Dream (Normal, no changes to health), and Nightmare (Hard, less health).  I chose to play on "Dream (Normal)" mode.  You can have up to 15 different save files, which is nice if you want to keep save files from different difficulties.  I appreciate the humor and banter among the characters.  I did not encounter any bugs in my playthrough.  

You use headphones to travel to various characters' dreams, explore them, and revisit them at times (pretty cool concept).  Some dreams are happy, some are grim.  The game is non-linear, which leads to lots of exploration.  Along the way you fight "glitches," that look like little flames (some will move around, some are stationary).  The glitches will either be orange (normal), red (harder), or purple (hardest).  After you defeat a glitch, it's gone for good.  If a glitch is too problematic, there is a limited amount of items that will let you skip a stationary glitch.  

There are limited amounts of battles (experience), healing items, and gold, so there is some resource management.  There are healing items, magic replenishing items, and stat boosting items to pick up from the ground.  These get consumed and used immediately when you walk over them.  (You can always just leave them there and grab them when you actually need them if you don't need them at the time - you may want to do this in case someone in your party is knocked out; some of the healing items will revive them.)  There are also a limited amount of permanent stat-boosting items you can purchase from various vendors.  As a note you can use the healer in Lostham, but if you do that you will not get the best rewards upon completing the game.

You'll get 3 additional party members along the way, for a total of 4.  One minor gripe with getting a new party member is that they always start at level 1 instead of joining your party at the level you're already at.  At least you do get all of your party members relatively early on, so catching up isn't that bad.  Each party member has their own unique/most helpful thing, see spoiler.  [spoiler]Erin (girl) is good at tanking hits, but also has a heal and does decent damage.  Athena (cat) is a good magic user.  Peeboo (mouse) is good at crowd control with "Carrot Transformation" and also good at physical damage.  Clochette (flower) is good at support, healing your team, boosting stats, and protecting from venom.  She also gets some pretty awesome set-damage weapons later in the game.)[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198152063660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6376, 'last_played': 1650825123}
review: Old school feel and gameplay in this retro rpg. Reminds me of the 90s ;) Cool - loves the characters (except Terry! Ugh leave him there already ;)) Had some annoying double triple back through previous locations to find some essential to complete the game item. The JAG mini game in the game has some "rooms" that make no sense at all... totally arbitrary "puzzles" that honestly, I had to use a guide to get through. The game movement is a bit troublesome as the group keeps getting stuck behind pillars and whatnot, but still a good play. I wouldn't do it again, but it was a nice little blast from the past vibe. Worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061606765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1646767588}
review:
I played this game after playing 3 really bad RPGs in a row and it was a nice breath of fresh area. It is different than  your average RPGMaker game in that it is part adventure game and part RPG. See early on you end up in this dreamscape, and are given the goal of figuring out how to get out of it. From there you have to explore and figure out how to progress. Some may find that off putting it but it reminded me of older Sierra games, especially Quest for Glory. Personally I liked trying to figure out how to progress through the dreamscapes while solving the puzzles and slowly getting farther and father into each based on the items I've found so far in my adventure.

If I had any criticism of this game it is I didn't really like the jailhouse games, they felt kinda tacked on when they occurred. Almost like they were there just to slow down the game a little at that point in the game. Outside of that though I have no other criticisms. Now where is Dreamscape 2?

author: {'steamid': '76561199058068753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1645709933}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979654703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1643003291}
review:
I liked this game much more than Aldorlea's Asguaard. It's still no Millennium series or The Book of Legends, but I think it was a solid challenge and a bunch of fun.

This is another relatively story-light game. It's heavy on exploration and plays almost like an adventure game at times. There's also a lot of resource management going on if you wish to complete the game without using the Full Heal Crystal. If you do that you unlock a party member for future runs of the game, but also it just makes the game more than just a push over. There's no inns, and healing items are extremely limited.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068489202', 'num_games_owned': 2726, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1638874381}
review:
[h1] Basura [/h1]

La verdad es que no sé como demonios llegó este juego a mi biblioteca... Si pagué por él, serían pocos céntimos, y solo por el mero hecho de que tiene cromos.

Lo cierto es que hoy me he aventurado en ejecutarlo, y me he encontrado con un juego de factura cutre, de calidad Game Boy Color. En inglés, con lo que la experiencia ha sido tan confusa como breve.

Típico RPG, copia barata de los primeros FF. 

Poco más que añadir. Extraes los cromos, y como vergonzosa basura que es, lo desinstalas y lo ocultas de tu biblioteca para no tener que recordar que esto existió alguna vez en tu cuenta de Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372971849', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1593659521}
review:
i want to like this game, i do. the graphics (both the pixeled And the artist rendered ones) are nice, simple and easy on the eyes. the music is a Weensy bit annoying in that you can't turn it down or off but it's nothing one can't just tune out mentally during game play.

but it has a couple detractors that are bit much for me.
*it stays on a tiny (mobile app) sized screen. so there's a constant case of "oops, the cursor is too far off the game now." and there's no options that i could see to change that. the main menu is "start", "load", "awards" and "quit". no settings or options. no way to turn off the music or change Anything.

*the movement is hardly intuitive. it's very literal. if there's anything between you and point B, guess what... you're going to be stuck on it. no "click here & Go Here". you have to be constantly clicking to keep moving... Including Around any seeming pointless object like a small pebble OR a corner you can see around easily... you can't just click a ways ahead and expect the character to actually Go There.

now, these aren't so much Deal Breakers as they are annoyances. i can't honestly say it wouldn't be something that i could just get used to over time. it's just at the time of my playing this game, i had NO patience for hand holding a game to play it. i've still got a few other games to finish that are less of a pain in the hinder.
again, this is one of those times i wish they allowed for the reviewer to abstain from a "yes"/"no" recommendation. for Me, it's a kind of an "meh, not a fan but maybe you'd like it?" deal.
i guess all i can do is say no, but take it with a grain of salt and make your own mind up on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393895951', 'num_games_owned': 1506, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1591437517}
review:
[h1] 游戏介绍 [/h1]
《Dreamscape》是一款由Aldorlea Games制作，Degica发行的角色扮演类冒险游戏。在一次失控的实验后，Erin被困在了梦境之中，为了找到出路，她只能依靠神奇的耳机（可以访问其他人的梦境与幻想中），游戏也就从此拉开了帷幕，接下来将会发生怎样的奇遇呢？

[h1] 游戏的体验 [/h1]
游戏的感受还是挺不错的，由于被困在梦境想要找寻出路，就需要去拜访其他人的梦境，找到所需要的物件，这就会有一种梦中有梦的感觉，很是魔幻，而且玩着玩着你会感受到其中所具有的关联性。剧情还是比较有意思的，有时会出现一些小转折，当然人物之间的对话也是很有趣的。游戏的战斗依旧采用回合制的方式向大家展现，但是难度不大，可以很容易的搞定，若实在困难难度下，则需要一定的斟酌，建议在完全状态下迎战比较好，可以好好的利用一下治疗水晶，除此之外，还会伴随一定的解谜，解谜还是比较重要的。

[h1] 游戏总结 [/h1]
游戏的质量还是很不错的，并且有着不错的可玩性，主要推荐给喜欢角色扮演类的玩家。
评分：6/10

[code]欢迎参观我的： [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33626600]奸商评测[/url]
喜欢这篇评论，可顺手点个赞，让更多人方便看到。[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025204938', 'num_games_owned': 2984, 'num_reviews': 489, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1556508630}
review:
Dialogue is very rough.  Game itself not very well optimized...sometimes in battles some of the on screen text (such as level up announcement) will be cut off by the character image.  First area gives one character a weapon but not the other, resulting in minimal damage.  Typical RPG-Maker level design with maze-like levels that sort of just spread all over the place.

Could be a lot of interesting ideas in here.  Entering the characters "dreams" (they are awake...?) seems interesting.  I see attempts at humor mixed in here.  Looks like there is some variety and unlockables as game progresses.  But I just couldn't make it that far before I had to bow out.  This game won't be bad for everyone, but it was bad for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020783130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1555992867}
review:
Dreamscape suffers a lot from inconsistent design. For example, the game mostly limits healing to random food items on the ground that must be used immediately (there is a free heal in the hub area, but using it locks out certain rewards). Initially, this forced a lot of annoying backtracking. A few hours in, I can now buy healing items at shops for paltry sums of money - is this supposed to negate the healing problem, or is there something else the game hasn't told me about?

Being able to explore the dreams of every character in the game seems like a promising idea, but the characters are flat and unmemorable. Moreover, it quickly becomes clear that this gives the game little to no sense of direction, and I found myself frequently searching in vain for the hook I needed to continue progressing forward. This was all the more annoying because some areas include unavoidable traps that inflict damage, so stumbling around lost is a waste of resources on top of being generally frustrating.

Bottom line, there are plenty of better RPGs out there. Try Ara Fell instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966511621', 'num_games_owned': 1216, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1544665075}
review:
After an hour i felt like this game wasn't going anywhere. The game is fairly non-linear, which would have been a good thing if there was a map and some indication of what you're doing. There are a number of impassable objects that block your path at certain points and x-type blocks that you can't destroy yet, but other than that it's very vague. Do you go into this mind or that mind? Who knows? It doesn't help that the "enemy threat indicator" (three different colours) is completely useless. A powerful group of mummies might be orange while some weedy trees are shown as red.

On top of that the world is filled with single-use items that will heal you, restore mana or boost your stats. When is the best time to use them? Who knows. What do the 20 different types of food do exactly? Yeah, good luck remembering that. Worst of all, levelling up does not restore you and healing items are quite rare, but using the town healer screws the entire game over for you (you won't get the bonus character). What kind of asshat came up with that? And yeah, it's a RPG-Maker game so you constantly get lost, combat is boring as hell and you constantly walk into scenery. 

The story is ok and some of the dialogue is nice, but there's just no good reason to play this. Go play Pokémon or Epic Battle Fantasy instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099765602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1542292483}
review:
In general it is good however my issue with the game is:

* Not enough indications to what items should be used for specific areas.

* Too much backtracking that I think you need a guide to finish the game - I used one to finish it -.

But all in good work has been done on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098400194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 463, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1536693611}
review:
Buen juego, pero lastrado por una serie de errores de diseño muy graves.
Me ha gustado el formato no lineal de la aventura. Pero, ¿por qué es necesario tanto backtracking?, ¿por qué no te dan apenas pistas de qué hay que hacer?, ¿por qué te obliga el diseño de las mazmorras a pasar por trampas que obligatoriamente te quitan vida?. Tuve que mirar en una guía la primera vez que me encontré una trampa como desactivarla, hasta que descubrí que no se pueden desactivar.
En fin, todo estos problemas, unido a una historia inexistente, hacen que no pueda recomendar este juego. Una lástima, porque podía ser un muy buen juego, con un poco más de pulido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 2216, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1535817535}
review:
a Little gem if there ever was one, with how shovel-ware games are pumped out on the steam store it has been no surprise finding small indie games that are all trash thats been pumped out to mil money, yet this was not the case with this little gem.

The story line isnt too major, but it is decent enough to enjoy. You are lost in dreams which you need to escape whilst trying to save your boyfriend, yeah this time your the damsel doing the rescuing. The progression isnt always simple, to proceed from one area to another you often have to go to a different area to and complete soething there to gain access in your previous area, so the game does offer some clever and enjoyable mechanics. The game is fairly simple regarding the fights, most fights don't re-spawn so once they are defeated you don't have too worry about fighting them again, some fights can be voided whilst some has to be fought to proceed.

The game can take up to 15 hours to complete and it offers 4 different difficulty modes to play at, so you have extra options there.  I'm not going into too much other detail, there are a few other reviews here that can offer more information should you wish for some more, but personally, a think this game is worth the money, it really is a nice little gem to add to your collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013571522', 'num_games_owned': 1912, 'num_reviews': 591, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1526156830}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2410, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1524120975}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045237529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1506222536}
review:
Bought this when the grand RPG maker shovelware apocalypse happened and everything was on sale. 

Its got about 15 hours of gameplay for one playthrough, with four difficulty modes. I think the intent is that you play it once on each, but I don't see how someone could stand that. 

Its a pretty neat take on a JRPG though. Encounters don't respawn, Most are mobile and can be avoided and the rest are static and must be fought to physically progress. The characters are cute and the game play is basically like a mix of a point and click adventure/puzzle game and a JRPG. Its neat and the story is decently engaging. 

There's an endurance element to it also. Vendors are rare and all but two sell only stat ups. Their inventory is fixed so once you buy them out they're done. Recovery is mainly through picking up items that are autoconsumed when picked up, and recover a small amount of HP or MP. Same for curatives. There are dmg/poison proc ones, sometimes the game tricks you wtih them or makes them required to walk through, or just requires you to always weave through a maze of them. Which is blah. 

Its not without some serious flaws though. Like most point and click games it can be frustrating to know where to go, since the path through is so backtrackey (get a thing that lets you break rocks, redo everywhere breaking the rocks to go new places, etc). Keys or key-like items (there are quite a few) have to be equipped to offhand to use, and the things that let you break the 3 different kinds of rocks (for real) have to as well, and later on the jumping item. That means you spend a lot of time in your menu scrolling through a big ass list to equip the key then immediately take it off and put back on your shield/good weapon/good charm. 

As a consequnce of the lack of one shot recovery at an inn or resting it makes things like getting poisoned or statused very frustrating. Especially early on, having someone die (all the pickups rez them but at one heatlh) or getting your team poisoned blows, it can be a hard stop on your playthrough. It also means later one when your last party member gets an in combat heal thats cheap (she has 3x your mana and it costs 1/4 what your protagonists heal does), you sandbag lots of routine fights to slowly heal. 

Your protagonist ends up being the tankiest by a wide margin, and has a free taunt and a counterattack proc when hit. Lots of fights especially lategame devolve into your protagonist just murdering everything on the crackback, including all the bosses. It leads to hilarious fights with some bosses and the non-boss enemies that use their sprite (they're all just recolors) since they can too, so once one of you hits the other you sit there counterattacking until someone dies. 

There was a really bad difficulty curve on mobs. A lot of areas are a pretty std level of strength with large jumps, which usually means you get to backtrack in the harder areas to go heal up and then slog back in. This is partially alleviated by two teleport items but you don't acquire them until right at the end of the game, since you would otherwise have to slog back through a really long empty room.

The ending, to cap it off, is rather unfulfilling. 

Thats a lot of negatives and no praise really, but despite that this game was very engaging, very charming, and fun. It had some really well done levels and sets, great music, and the cutest theme imaginable. This is definitely worth playing if you think you can deal with the negatives ( or don't consider them to be, different strokes for different folks).

author: {'steamid': '76561198011611421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1496555742}
review: Dreamscape was just okay. The game play was alright but the storyline was disappointing especially towards the end. I was able to win the game in about 15 hours, which if I had spent the total retail price I would have been bummed. I got this game on a Steam Sale.  I have enjoyed a lot of other Aldorlea Games, but this is my least favorite. I don't see myself replaying this game :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198214989148', 'num_games_owned': 2346, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 5823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1733, 'playtime_at_review': 2385, 'last_played': 1712275142}
review:
Alright this game, I know its rpgmaker, but this is Aldorlea for crying out loud!  This is by far one of their best games I've played!  And I've played some really good games, and really bad games.  This one is a solid 8/10.   If anything bad can be said about the game is that its a little too open, and very little direction is given.

I actually the first time through the game had to stop, because I couldn't figure out a way to make any more progress whatsoever.  I had to look at the guide multiple times in order to figure out how to beat this game.  It's not bad in the aspect of difficulty (unless doing true nightmare mode) but it is confusing on the 'where do I go now' portion.  Several key items are in areas you normally wouldn't expect, or you do things in ways that are a little too obvious.  

The biggest example is that there's a big brown mouse at the beginning of the game that there is no real indication that he's your next party member XD.  You have to talk to him to unlock the next area and get the giggle bell, which gives you a key to unlock stuff in egypt, and the list goes on.

But this is by far a super creative and fun game!  Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056752045', 'num_games_owned': 1330, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1510341738}
review: This is quite possibly the most interesting and well done RPG maker game I have ever seen. The story is pretty good. The non linear design is exception, but slightly frustrating at times. The game is difficult and with the additional game modes it has pretty good replay value. For the player who misses old school RPGs, and is tired of all those 2 hour half baked RPG maker games I definitely suggest you check out dreamscape!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065209195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1610483051}
review:
OK, I have to admit that I was fully prepared to hate this game.  It came in a bundle, and the description made me cringe.  I went through every other game and decided I would give it a try.  Turns out, I'm glad I did.  

This is the only game I have ever been tempted to play through a second time! Mechanics are easy to follow like most RPG maker games.  Money isn't wasted on constantly buying potions etc because of the drop system. Story and characters are a blast! It took me roughly 17 hours to play through, so definitely worth the bundle price I paid for it.  If you like Aldorlea Games, you won't be disappointed in this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1448395720}

https://youtu.be/SKFfj11_sD0

author: {'steamid': '76561198119901505', 'num_games_owned': 3301, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1461011560}
review:
еще один продукт продукт от Aldorlea Games на все том же РПГ-Мейкере. но на этот раз всё немножко не так, как обычно у них получается и это хорошо. по сравнению с остальными играми тут добавлено куча мелких, но приятных, новшеств, к обычному рпг стилю добавили платформенную составляющую, в изобилии итемы валяются прям на земле, немного иной подход к дополнительным статам и много другое. и конечно не последнюю роль играет сюжет, добрая, местами забавная, затягивающая история о прогулках в сновидениях (привет маленькому Нэмо).  
и в целом, данный представитель рпг заслуживает чтоб в него поиграли. рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995309346', 'num_games_owned': 4541, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1461004174}
review: Да, пусть это сделано в RPG Maker'е, но насколько необычно выглядят переходы от приключенческого режима к аркадно-платформенному и наоборот! Завязка сюжета интригует, а обилие параметров, навыков и слотов под дополнительных товарищей в вашем отряде только лишь раззадоривает поскорее разведать все её секреты :) Отличная поделка.

author: {'steamid': '76561198231164576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1461061048}
review:
Классная игра, от известной респектабельной компании. Dreamscape достойно держится среди игр схожего жанра и не уступает своим предшественникам. Один сюжет чего стоит.
Для игры хватает базовых знаний английского языка, хотя русский очень даже не помешал бы. Достойное рпг на движке RPG Maker от достойной компании Aldorlea Games.
Рекомендую, 9 рпг из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066847068', 'num_games_owned': 2976, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1460988921}
review:
Значит все было так, идем мы модной девченкой на свиданку, по телефону трындим, находим своего хахаля и тут... Трах-бабах, и мы в сказке, хахаль смылся, а нам разруливай.Плащ красивенный дали, а пушку, чтоб супостатов мочить не дали. Значит идем мы ,монетоки собираем (а ля марио) и тут нам дед встречается. Говорит, доча, у тя наушники волшебные с телепортом, а вон тот кот-наркоман тебя ими научит пользоваться. Короч кот учит, но не просто так, а за офигенецкую рогатку, у нас таких в жизни не было и...... 
Веселая история, требующая знания английского ,но без него додумать то еще веселье )))) Картинка приятная, музыка на уровне ,сюжет выше описан первая часть. Для любителей жанра маст хэв, остальным рекомендую для ознакомления.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080472994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 542, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1459095517}
review:
Довольно красивый представитель игр созданных на движке «RPG Maker».
По сюжету девушка приходит к парню и происходит масса не объяснимого и не понятного. (тока пожалуйста без пошлых мыслей, тут не об этом)
В игре присутствуют:
*забавный кот
*коллекционные карточки
*Steam Cloud
*игра поддерживает джойстик как и многие на движке «RPG Maker»
*сохранения в любой момент игры на карте (в некоторых играх требовалось искать где сохранять прогресс)

author: {'steamid': '76561198142019150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1467712613}
review:
Dreamscape-очередное творение уже всем известной компании.
Отмечу уникальный сюжет для каждого персонажа ,рисовку,сложные головоломки,красивую графику.
Чем дальше вы проходите,тем сложнее становится игра.
Вам нравятся ролевые игры? Вам нравятся RPG? Тогда чего вы ждёте? Скорее приобретайте и играйте в Dreamscape.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050442172', 'num_games_owned': 1670, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1455996818}
review:
Весьма интересная игра, которую нам подарила компания Aldorlea Games. Это не первая игра этой компании в которые я играл и могу сказать, что она достойно держится среди игр схожего жанра и не уступает своим предшественникам. Мне понравилась рисовка игры и естественно её сюжет. 
Небольшим минусом является отсутствие иных локализации игры, посему, необходимо знание английского языка. Однако, этот минус теряется на фоне самой игры.)
Я рекомендую сыграть в эту игру, всем любителям ролевых игр)

author: {'steamid': '76561198112795684', 'num_games_owned': 6980, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1454856090}
review:
Очень забавная из игр компании Aldorlea Games. Довольно красивый представитель игр созданных на движке «RPG Maker».
По сюжету девушка приходит к парню и происходит масса не объяснимого и не понятного. (тока пожалуйста без пошлых мыслей, тут не об этом)....

Из минусов:
*отсутствие русской локализации (текст). Знание английского языка желательно, для понимания всего сюжета, хотя можно разобраться без знания языка.
*достижения
*при нажатии F12- не делает скриншоты и не ставит игру на паузу, а тупо перегружает игру и выводит главное меню игры

В игре присутствуют:
*забавный кот
*коллекционные карточки
*Steam Cloud
*игра поддерживает джойстик как и многие на движке «RPG Maker»
*сохранения в любой момент игры на карте (в некоторых играх требовалось искать где сохранять прогресс)

author: {'steamid': '76561198129024493', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1174, 'last_played': 1450317594}
review:
It is a fun and light game. Dreamscapes are very interenting and open vide range of odd and funny possibilities, which are used by the makers in this game. Even though I wished there would be more companion characters, it doesn't mean i didn't like them.

Specifically crafted set of abilities and usable items for each character allows you to use startegy during fights and brings a number of chuckles when you find new items.

I vwry much liked unique system of replenishing helath and mana. It makes you run around looking for food a bit, but totally makes sense. Better you play and fight, the less time you need to spend on this.

I am not a fan of the ending, but the works thing in this game for me, was running back to places unlocked by a new item. I am glad makers gave a number of "shortcuts" especially toward the end.

Overall I think this game is enjoyable and lets you enjoy several hours to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099826898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2672, 'last_played': 1538636113}

author: {'steamid': '76561198249853896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1447089812}
review:
NOT bought nor played on steam.

The story is simple: your boyfriend catches you in your imagination with magical headphones, you have to free him, 

Some humor in the dialogues, surprising characters. If you finish the game you unlock a foreign character(from another 2D RPG)  and have him in your party for a 2nd walktrough at another mode. You explore each character’s dream.

My gameplay advices:  find the easiest dream on monsters to start with or you’ll feel stuck. You have to pick a strategy to get XP cos monsters don’t respawn. Bosses are quite hard but optional. There's no or FEW restor items!!
 There’s the temptation of the fairy in the in-between dreams which can restore you but if you use her you won’t get a great reward.  If I’m correct you need an item from a dream for another. 

I recommend the unique and challenging gameplay, the time of playing is very long, 
I don’t recommend if you want a good end as the end is disappointing to me. So much work for this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063606917', 'num_games_owned': 936, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1452306545}
review:
There's something about Dreamscape that's different than most RPGs, especially as an indie title. So far, I've unlocked 4 of the playable characters and all of them are completely different. And I do mean COMPLETELY different, which is really awesome. The story is as simple as the main character searching for her boyfriend that's gone missing, but the story is so compelling that it really is the journey that is more important than the destination. Logistically, this game has unique features that most RPGs do not have. For one, battles can be choose and most enemies do not regenerate at all. This helps you tell where you've been and where you haven't been. Also items are not put directly in your inventory; instead, you have to decide whether you should pick them up now and use them or wait till later to grab them. This adds strategy to the gameplay. 

On top of the great story and gameplay, the game is just overall whimsical and colorful and really embarks some of the visual aesthetics of games such as Earthbound. 

Overall, if you love RPGs, then this is the game for you. For only $10, you get hours of fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065943884', 'num_games_owned': 2202, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1429827317}
review: Like with the Millennium series, this game is well done and a real tribute for JRPG of the 16-bits era. The characters are lovable and the story unfold at a good pace. Since I'm a cat lover (don't worry I'm also a dog lover), having one as a playable character is a treat. As of now, I'm still in the process of beating the game so I can't say how long the game is, but Aldorlea has given us good games worthy of our money so far and I doubt this one is any exception. Hope they keep up the good work, cause we want more JRPGs like the ones they've done so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994666064', 'num_games_owned': 3746, 'num_reviews': 611, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1428373043}
review:
Aí está um exemplo de RPG com uma mecânica interessante pra caramba, a ideia de poder entrar nos sonhos e fantasias daqueles que você conhece é apresentada aqui e assim você vai vagando por mundos,quem está enjoado de temáticas sempre iguais, essa pode dar uma boa variada. Análise completa aqui:

http://www.nerdmaldito.com/2015/04/dreamscape-um-rpg-no-universo-dos-sonhos.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198067119595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1582191680}
review:
This most recent offering on Steam from Aldorlea confirms again that these developers are at the top of the list of those making the old school/adventure style games. Dreamscape has everything a fan of these games could want, and much more.

As always, these games are driven by the story, and, IMO, Aldorlea always has this element perfected. In the game you are Erin ---- who is on a mission to save her boyfriend. Sounds simple enough, but to accomplish this seemingly straightforward task she has some magical headphones that allow her to enter the dreams of virtually everyone she comes in contact with including a cat, a mouse, and a plant. Together, they explore the dreamworlds of those within their own dreams (an adventurer, an old man, a dog, a pharaoh, and many others). So much for simplicity ---- yet the story remains tightly organized, and everything makes sense. Some of the dreams are simple, some complex, and they all add up to a story that is beautifully put together with no meandering that completely draws you in and holds your interest in a completely captivating way.

With so much to see and do Dreamscape is a long one, and offers high replay value with 4 levels of difficulty that offer new challenges. The game offers an innovation that is different in that the items you need for good health and magic are not always able to be stored in your inventory, but are found everywhere in the world to be used or left behind for later ---- your decision, and an interesting spin on the ordinary. But there are plenty of items so it never becomes a problem (at least not in the easiest level, which I am playing).

Character development is excellent (even Marine from the Millennium series makes an appearance), and offers a lot of good humor ---- it's easy to like these characters as they offer their comments to one another while exploring ---- especially the cat.

Gameplay is with either the keyboard or mouse, and both work well.

The artwork is very nicely done, and includes some very different and detailed scenes as you travel throughout the various dreams. The music is pleasant and unobtrusive which adds to the enjoyment of the game.

This is a very creative and different rpg that shows great care and attention to detail by the developer that I would enthusiastically recommend to anyone of any age. And, if you have never experienced an Aldorlea game, this one is a fine place to start. But, then, I would say that about any of their games here on Steam. Enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041791247', 'num_games_owned': 1696, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1428237154}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073088368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1425406771}
review: I beat this game yesterday and from the company that made Millennium this game had a pretty good storyline to it, but it was also weird to play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070835518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1433515460}
review:
Dreamscape (DSC) is quite a unique and refreshing game. You are lost in dreams and need to escape (and rescue your boyfriend in the process). But the path is far from linear - in order to progress in one dream you often need to do or get something in another one. This makes the different dreams "linked", and since each of them feel very distinct, the frequent "jumping" helps feel the game various and enjoyable. Plus, there are also dreams in dreams...

 So basically, on lower difficulties, DSC is a bit like a puzzle / adventure game. The battles (turn-based, btw) are relatively easy. Exploring the dreams and solving the puzzles is your main goal. And if you should run out of health / spells you just can teleport to the beginning and touch a healing crystal.
 If you are a dedicated player, DSC offers much more, though. For completing the game you get a reward - bonus characters, resistance to poison, ... - it depends on the mode you played in.
 But, if you complete it without touching the healing crystal, you get better reward. And there's a catch, the game only offers a limited amount of resources. Enemies don't respawn, which means your experience earned (translating into levels) is limited. You earn money by picking coins on the maps, and these are limited, too. And on top of that, the consumables cannot be stored in inventory and are consumed just as you touch them. Plus, you heal a tiny amount after each won battle.

 So, on harder difficulties the game becomes very tactical and challenging. Since the enemies are progressively harder and harder as you venture further into the dreams, you need to balance very carefully how to play. Some battles can be too "costly" in terms of healing required, some easier ones can be left behind and used for "healing" later and so on.
 The "True Nightmare" (playing on the Nightmare difficulty "from the scratch" (i.e. no bonuses) and without touching the crystal truly deserves its name. I even dare to say it was the hardest game I have ever played.

 The other aspects of DSC will be no surprise for those familiar with Aldorlea games - funny characters and dialogues, unexpected plot twists and many secrets. And the music feels really dreamy. Together with the replayability and the great variety of dreams (deserts, cities, some are funny, other ones scary or more adventurous ...), DSC is one of my favorites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080614433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1426226690}
review:
Dispite being mostly a good game, I cannot continure playing it due to a game breaking bug in JAG 12, basically preventing the game from letting you past that one point.

EDIT: Found the problem, but you have to run into the wall to the left of the starting point first, a bug that can really break the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043809494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1494683925}
review:
Одна из лучших игр на RPG Maker, виденной мною, а уж сравнивать есть с чем. Причем так-то ничего нового вы не увидите, стандартная боевка и интерфейс, но идея... Возможность с помощью волшебных наушников вселяться в сознания людей и существ впечатляет. Что водится у кошки в голове? Мыши! Прогулка по ночному Лондону в сознании старика может привести к внезапной смерти от рук Джека Потрошителя (главная героиня - красивая лоли). Во другом городе во время войны можно находиться всего несколько секунд - начинается бомбежка.

Вселяться можно практически в кого угодно с некоторыми ограничениями, и всегда нас ждет совершенно новый мир внутри. Баланс сражений более-менее проработан, но проблемы все те же, что и у других игр на Мейкере - становится играть или слишком просто или непроходимо. Сам Steam с Мейкером не подружился никак - оверлея нет, управление определяется на больного осьминого автоматически, а F12 перезагружает игру.

Игра впечатлила пираткой еще много лет назад, и клево, что ее наконец можно купить в Steam. Хотя цена несколько высоковата даже на мой нежадный взгляд. Ждем Eternal Eden.
